cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 170, Number 145 (Wednesday, September 18, 2024)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. DeSAULNIER:H.R. 9651.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8The single subject of this legislation is:To direct the Secretary of Labor to establish a renewableenergy transition grant program and to establish a NationalEmployment Corps[Page H5447]

item.title: Jobs for a Carbon Free Transportation System Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Railroads, Pipelines, and Hazardous Materials.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.

bill.title: Protecting Workers for a Clean Future Act

item.title: Protecting Workers for a Clean Future Act
Protecting Workers for a Clean Future Act
To direct the Secretary of Labor to establish a renewable energy transition grant program and to establish a National Employment Corps, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
